intro: Myoporum wilderi, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It features lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fibrous bark has historically been used by Māori for making ropes and mats. Myoporum wilderi is well adapted to coastal and rocky environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils.
